meanings.definition: A group of singers or dancers performing together.
meanings.sent1: The school chorus sang beautifully at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The audience clapped and cheered as the chorus finished their performance.
meanings.sent3: The chorus of birds outside my window woke me up early in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The chorus of voices in the choir blended harmoniously.
meanings.sent5: The children's chorus filled the room with joyous melodies.

meanings.definition: A part of a song that is repeated after each verse.
meanings.sent1: The catchy chorus of the song got stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent2: Everyone sang along to the chorus when it came on the radio.
meanings.sent3: The chorus of the song was so infectious that even the grumpiest person started humming along.
meanings.sent4: The chorus of the song echoed through the stadium, uniting the crowd in song.
meanings.sent5: The powerful chorus of the anthem brought tears to many eyes.

meanings.definition: A group of people who speak or act together.
meanings.sent1: The protestors shouted their demands in unison, forming a chorus of voices.
meanings.sent2: The chorus of opinions in the meeting made it hard to reach a decision.
meanings.sent3: The chorus of laughter from the audience made the comedian's jokes even funnier.
meanings.sent4: The chorus of support from her friends gave her the courage to speak up.
meanings.sent5: The chorus of cheers erupted as the team scored the winning goal.
